archimate:Device.name: Nursing Documentation Mobile Cart (NDMC)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• Bedside patient documentation, real-time updates to EMR/EHR, medication administration tracking, patient vitals monitoring, and clinical communication on wards.
Specifications:
• Screen Size and Resolution: o 24 FHD Matte Anti-Reflective + Projected Capacitive (P-Cap) touchscreen, providing clarity and usability for detailed clinical documentation. • Touch Interface Responsiveness: o High-sensitivity capacitive touchscreen, optimized for clinical use with gloves, stylus, or bare hands o Multi-touch support for intuitive interactions. • Battery Life: o 16hr (2x hot-swappable batteries) + USB-C PD charging for continuous runtime per full charge, supporting a full nursing shift o Hot-swappable battery system for uninterrupted operation. • Connectivity Options: o Integrated Wi-Fi 6 (ensure compliance with access points) (802.11ax or higher) for reliable wireless connectivity o Bluetooth 5.1 or higher for barcode scanners, label printers, and other peripheral devices o Ethernet connectivity option for wired connections o USB-A ports (minimum 3 ports), USB-C, and audio jack for peripheral integration. • Operating System: o Windows 11 Pro (Healthcare-ready configuration) with compatibility for hospital EMR/EHR and clinical software. • Durability and Build Quality: o Medical-grade, antimicrobial surfaces resistant to hospital-grade cleaning solutions o Ruggedized construction capable of withstanding frequent use, spills, and accidental impacts o Spill-resistant keyboard and sealed touchscreen panel. • Weight and Dimensions: o Compact, lightweight mobile cart, approximately 18–22 inches width x 18–22 inches depth o Adjustable height (approx. 36–48 inches) for comfortable ergonomic use o Weight optimized for ease of maneuverability (< 40 lbs total). • Security Features: o Biometric (fingerprint) or RFID card-based authentication for secure staff login o Integrated TPM 2.0 module for secure encryption of patient data o Lockable storage compartment for documentation and accessories o Remote asset tracking and device management capability o Compliant with HIPAA and applicable security standards. o Proximity auto-lock (logs out if staff walks away) • Input Methods: o Integrated spill-resistant keyboard and multi-touch screen interface o clinical stylus input support for precision entry o Barcode scanner compatible via USB or Bluetooth for medication and patient ID scanning. • Protective Equipment: o Bumper guards for impact protection o Lockable wheels for stable positioning and safety o Antimicrobial screen protector and keyboard cover.
